Key Match Events: Lautaro Martínez scored twice to secure a 2-0 victory for Argentina over Peru.
Ángel Di María provided a nicely placed through ball for Martínez’s first goal in the 47th minute.
Martínez doubled Argentina’s lead in the 86th minute.
Nicolás Tagliafico's goal was disallowed due to a ruling that goaltender Pedro Gallese was blocked.
Leandro Paredes missed a penalty after hitting the right post.
Post-Match Reflections: Lautaro Martínez expressed his enjoyment of playing for Argentina and his desire to prove himself to the coach.
Argentina assistant Walter Samuel commented on Messi's injury status, stating that Messi is getting better but it is too early to tell if he will play in the next match.
Peru coach Jorge Fossati described Peru’s performance as the weakest of their three games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in front of about 64,000 fans at the Miami Dolphins’ Hard Rock Stadium.
Argentina controlled possession (74%) and had six shots on goal.
Argentina will face the runner-up of Group B in the knockout stage on Thursday in Houston.
Argentina aims for a record 16th Copa America title.
Peru was held without a goal for the third game of the tournament.
